Do1  —v. (3 sing. Pres. Does; past did; past part. Done; pres. Part. Doing) 1 perform, carry out, achieve, complete (work etc.) (did his homework; a lot to do). 2 produce, make, provide (doing a painting; we do lunches). 3 grant; impart (does you good; do me a favour). 4 act, behave, proceed (do as i do; would do well to wait). 5 work at (do carpentry; do chemistry). 6 be suitable or acceptable; satisfy (will never do; will do me nicely). 7 deal with; attend to (do one's hair). 8 fare; get on (did badly in the test). 9 solve; work out (did the sum). 10 a traverse (a certain distance) (did 50 miles today). B travel at a specified speed (was doing eighty). 11 colloq. Act or behave like; play the part of. 12 produce (a play, opera, etc.) (will do shakespeare). 13 a colloq. Finish (i've done in the garden). B (as done adj.) Be finished (day is done). 14 cook, esp. Completely (do it in the oven; potatoes aren't done). 15 be in progress (what's doing?). 16 colloq. Visit (did the museums). 17 colloq. A (often as done adj.) Exhaust; tire out. B defeat, kill, ruin. 18 (foll. By into) translate or transform. 19 colloq. Cater for (they do one very well here). 20 slang a rob (did a big bank). B swindle. 21 slang prosecute, convict (done for shoplifting). 22 slang undergo (a term of imprisonment). 23 slang take (an illegal drug). —v.aux. 1 in questions and negative statements or commands (do you understand?; i don't smoke; don't be silly). 2 ellipt. Or in place of a verb (you know her better than i do; i wanted to go and i did; tell me, do!). 3 for emphasis (i do want to; do tell me; they did go). 4 in inversion (rarely does it happen). —n. (pl. Dos or do's) colloq. Elaborate party, operation, etc.  be done with see *done. Be nothing to do with 1 be no business of. 2 be unconnected with. Be to do with be concerned or connected with. Do away with colloq. 1 get rid of; abolish. 2 kill. Do down colloq. 1 cheat, swindle. 2 overcome. Do for 1 be satisfactory or sufficient for. 2 colloq. (esp. As done for adj.) Destroy, ruin, kill. 3 colloq. Act as cleaner etc. For. Do in 1 slang a kill. B ruin. 2 colloq. Exhaust, tire out. Do justice to see *justice. Do nothing for (or to) colloq. Not flatter or enhance. Do or die persist recklessly. Do out colloq. Clean or redecorate (a room). Do a person out of colloq. Cheat of. Do over 1 slang attack; beat up. 2 colloq. Redecorate, refurbish. Do proud see *proud. Dos and don'ts rules of behaviour. Do something for (or to) colloq. Enhance the appearance or quality of. Do up 1 fasten. 2 colloq. A refurbish, renovate. B adorn, dress up. Do with (prec. By could) would be glad of; would profit by (could do with a rest). Do without manage without; forgo.

An emotional relationship, involving three people.  triangular adj. [latin: related to *tri-]

-metric  comb. Form (also -metrical) forming adjectives corresponding to nouns in -meter and -metry (thermometric; geometric).



Vertiginous  adj. Of or causing vertigo. [latin: related to *vertigo]
Ink  —n. 1 coloured fluid or paste used for writing, printing, etc. 2 black liquid ejected by a cuttlefish etc. —v. 1 (usu. Foll. By in, over, etc.) Mark with ink. 2 cover (type etc.) With ink. [greek egkauston purple ink used by roman emperors]

Lag3  n. Slang habitual convict. [origin unknown]

Juvenile court  n. Court for children under 17.

Lobotomy  n. (pl. -ies) incision into the frontal lobe of the brain, formerly used in some cases of mental disorder. [from *lobe]

B (usu. Foll. By to) communicate feeling etc.; affect, touch (the sunset spoke to her).  generally (or strictly etc.) Speaking in the general (or strict etc.) Sense. Attention  n. 1 act or faculty of applying one's mind; notice (attention wandered; attract his attention). 2 consideration, care. 3 (in pl.) A courtesies. B sexual advances. 4 erect esp. Military attitude of readiness.

Yeoman of the guard  n. Member of the sovereign's bodyguard.

Levis  n.pl. (also levi's propr.) Type of (orig. Blue) denim jeans or overalls reinforced with rivets. [levi strauss, name of the manufacturer]
Housework  n. Regular housekeeping work, e.g. Cleaning and cooking.
Psycho-  comb. Form of the mind or psychology. [greek: related to *psychic]
Nullify  v. (-ies, -ied) neutralize, invalidate.  nullification n.




Forth  adv. Archaic except in set phrases 1 forward; into view (bring forth; come forth). 2 onwards in time (from this time forth). 3 forwards (back and forth). 4 out from a starting-point (set forth).  and so forth see *so1. [old english]
Forsythia  n. Shrub with bright yellow flowers in early spring. [forsyth, name of a botanist]
Level crossing  n. Crossing of a railway and a road, or two railways, at the same level.
Swarm1  —n. 1 cluster of bees leaving the hive with the queen to establish a new colony. 2 large cluster of insects, birds, or people. 3 (in pl.; foll. By of) great numbers. —v. 1 move in or form a swarm. 2 (foll. By with) (of a place) be overrun, crowded, or infested with. [old english]
Unpracticed  adj. (brit. Unpractised) 1 not experienced or skilled. 2 not put into practice.

Stool-pigeon  n. 1 person acting as a decoy. 2 police informer.
Ramify  v. (-ies, -ied) (cause to) form branches, subdivisions, or offshoots; branch out. [latin ramus branch]



Adorable  adj. 1 deserving adoration. 2 colloq. Delightful, charming.
Ab initio  adv. From the beginning. [latin]


Overcast  adj. 1 (of the sky) covered with cloud. 2 (in sewing) edged with stitching to prevent fraying.


Inevitable  —adj. 1 unavoidable; sure to happen. 2 colloq. Tiresomely familiar. —n. (prec. By the) inevitable fact, event, etc.  inevitability n. Inevitably adv. [latin evito avoid]

Rehung  past and past part. Of *rehang.
Unattractive  adj. Not attractive.  unattractively adv.

Yup  var. Of *yep.
Meretricious  adj. Showily but falsely attractive. [latin meretrix prostitute]


Ringworm  n. Fungal skin infection causing circular inflamed patches, esp. On the scalp.

Fontanelle  n. (us fontanel) membranous space in an infant's skull at the angles of the parietal bones. [latin fontanella little *fountain]


Black and white  —n. Writing or printing (in black and white). —adj. 1 (of a film etc.) Monochrome. 2 consisting of extremes only, oversimplified.
Antler  n. Branched horn of a stag or other deer.  antlered adj. [french]


Barley sugar  n. Sweet made from sugar, usu. In twisted sticks.
Filly  n. (pl. -ies) 1 young female horse. 2 colloq. Girl or young woman. [old norse]

Runway  n. Specially prepared surface for aircraft taking off and landing.


Maharanee  n. (also maharani) (pl. -s) hist. Maharaja's wife or widow. [hindi, = great ranee]


Got  past and past part. Of *get.








Oau  abbr. Organization of african unity.
Philosophize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 reason like a philosopher. 2 speculate; theorize.  philosophizer n.


-ion  suffix (usu. As -sion, -tion, -xion) forming nouns denoting: 1 verbal action (excision). 2 instance of this (a suggestion). 3 resulting state or product (vexation; concoction). [latin -io]
Prescript  n. Ordinance, law, command. [latin: related to *prescribe]
Sleepless  adj. 1 lacking sleep (sleepless night). 2 unable to sleep. 3 continually active.  sleeplessness n.


Telephone book  n. = *telephone directory.
Crack-brained  adj. Crazy.
Yellow flag  n. Flag displayed by a ship in quarantine.

 



Troika  n. 1 a russian vehicle with a team of three horses abreast. B this team. 2 group of three people, esp. As an administrative council. [russian]
Ship  —n. 1 large seagoing vessel. 2 us aircraft. 3 spaceship. —v. (-pp-) 1 put, take, or send away in a ship. 2 a take in (water) over a ship's side etc. B lay (oars) at the bottom of a boat. C fix (a rudder etc.) In place. 3 a embark. B (of a sailor) take service on a ship. 4 deliver (goods) to an agent for forwarding.  ship off send away.
Driftwood  n. Wood floating on moving water or washed ashore.
Muscatel  n. 1 = *muscat. 2 raisin from a muscat grape.


Ménage  n. Household. [latin: related to *manor]


Coeliac disease  n. Disease of the small intestine, brought on by contact with dietary gluten. [latin coeliacus from greek koilia belly]
Simultaneous  adj. (often foll. By with) occurring or operating at the same time.  simultaneity n. Simultaneously adv. [latin simul at the same time]
Usage  credulous is sometimes confused with credible.


Deter  v. (-rr-) (often foll. By from) discourage or prevent, esp. Through fear.  determent n. [latin terreo frighten]
Deceitful  adj. Using deceit.  deceitfully adv. Deceitfulness n.

Specific heat capacity  n. Heat required to raise the temperature of the unit mass of a given substance by a given amount (usu. One degree).
Bullet  n. Small pointed missile fired from a rifle, revolver, etc. [french diminutive of boule ball]

Doe  abbr. Department of the environment.
Both  —adj. & pron. The two, not only one (both boys; both the boys; both of the boys; i like both). —adv. With equal truth in two cases (is both hot and dry). [old norse]
Licit  adj. Formal permitted, lawful. [latin: related to *licence]
Sponge bag  n. Waterproof bag for toilet articles.
Actinism  n. Property of short-wave radiation that produces chemical changes, as in photography. [greek aktis ray]

Aliphatic  adj. Chem. Of organic compounds in which carbon atoms form open chains, not aromatic rings. [greek aleiphar -phat- fat]
Black watch  n. (prec. By the) royal highland regiment.
Pro tem  adj. & adv. Colloq. = *pro tempore. [abbreviation]
French dressing  n. Salad dressing of seasoned vinegar and oil.
Bye1  n. 1 cricket run scored from a ball that passes the batsman without being hit. 2 status of an unpaired competitor in a sport, who proceeds to the next round by default. [from *by as a noun]





Antiviral  adj. Effective against viruses.


Whey  n. Watery liquid left when milk forms curds. [old english]
Cheapskate  n. Esp. Us colloq. Stingy person.
Overambitious  adj. Excessively ambitious.
Dervish  n. Member of a muslim fraternity vowed to poverty and austerity. [turkish from persian, = poor]





Scrubber  n. 1 slang promiscuous woman. 2 apparatus for purifying gases etc.


Gadabout  n. Person who gads about.
Combings  n.pl. Hairs combed off.

Stag  n. 1 adult male deer. 2 stock exch. Slang person who applies for new shares, intending to sell at once for a profit. [old english]


Countess  n. 1 wife or widow of a count or earl. 2 woman holding the rank of count or earl. [latin comitissa: related to *count2]
Rabid  adj. 1 affected with rabies, mad. 2 violent, fanatical.  rabidity n. [latin rabio rave]

Lineage  n. Lineal descent; ancestry. [latin: related to *line1]
Teensy  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. = *teeny.


Lance  —n. Long spear, esp. One used by a horseman. —v. (-cing) 1 prick or cut open with a lancet. 2 pierce with a lance. [french from latin]

Luncheon meat  n. Tinned meat loaf of pork etc.
Chandelier  n. Ornamental branched hanging support for lighting. [french: related to *candle]
Ordinary level  n. Hist. Lowest level of the gce examination.

High-water mark  n. Level reached at high water.


Bone-idle  adj. Utterly idle.

Seaworthy  adj. Fit to put to sea.  seaworthiness n.

White russian  n. = *byelorussian.
Crenelate  v. (brit. Crenellate) (-ting) provide (a tower etc.) With battlements.  crenellation n. [french crenel embrasure]



Enclose  v. (-sing) 1 a surround with a wall, fence, etc. B shut in. 2 put in a receptacle (esp. In an envelope with a letter). 3 (usu. As enclosed adj.) Seclude (a religious community) from the outside world. [latin: related to *include]

Infallible  adj. 1 incapable of error. 2 unfailing; sure to succeed. 3 (of the pope) incapable of doctrinal error.  infallibility n. Infallibly adv.
Non-transferable  adj. That may not be transferred.
Pedicure  n. 1 care or treatment of the feet, esp. The toenails. 2 person practising this for a living. [latin pes ped- foot, cura care]
Voracious  adj. 1 gluttonous, ravenous. 2 very eager (voracious reader).  voraciously adv. Voracity n. [latin vorax from voro devour]
Spot check  n. Sudden or random check.
Hocus-pocus  n. Deception; trickery. [sham latin]

Spite  —n. Ill will, malice. —v. (-ting) hurt, harm, or frustrate (a person) through spite.  in spite of notwithstanding. [french: related to *despite]
Crockery  n. Earthenware or china dishes, plates, etc. [related to *crock2]


Carob  n. Seed pod of a mediterranean tree used as a chocolate substitute. [arabic karruba]
Amorphous  adj. 1 of no definite shape. 2 vague. 3 mineral. & chem. Non-crystalline. [greek a- not, morphe form]
Finance  —n. 1 management of (esp. Public) money. 2 monetary support for an enterprise. 3 (in pl.) Money resources of a state, company, or person. —v. (-cing) provide capital for. [french: related to *fine2]
Flashback  n. Scene set in an earlier time than the main action.
Dune  n. Drift of sand etc. Formed by the wind. [dutch: related to *down3]
Grovel  v. (-ll-; us -l-) 1 behave obsequiously. 2 lie prone in abject humility.  grovelling adj. [obsolete grovelling (adv.) From old norse á grúfu face down]
Road sign  n. Sign giving information or instructions to road users.

Clangour  n. (us clangor) prolonged clanging.  clangorous adj.
Progression  n. 1 progressing. 2 succession; series. [latin: related to *progress]

Poetry  n. 1 art or work of a poet. 2 poems collectively. 3 poetic or tenderly pleasing quality. [medieval latin: related to *poet]

Controversy  n. (pl. -ies) prolonged argument or dispute. [latin: related to *controvert]
Turbofan  n. Jet engine in which a turbine-driven fan provides additional thrust.






Old boy  n. 1 former male pupil of a school. 2 colloq. A elderly man. B (as a form of address) = *old man.
Undercoat  n. 1 a layer of paint under a topcoat. B paint for this. 2 animal's under layer of hair etc.
Pinnate  adj. (of a compound leaf) having leaflets on either side of the leaf-stalk. [latin pinnatus feathered: related to *pinnacle]
Basket  n. 1 container made of interwoven cane, reed, wire, etc. 2 amount held by this. 3 the goal in basketball, or a goal scored. 4 econ. Group or range (of currencies). [french]




Strop  —n. Device, esp. A strip of leather, for sharpening razors. —v. (-pp-) sharpen on a strop. [low german or dutch]


Magnetic tape  n. Plastic strip coated with magnetic material for recording sound or pictures.



Unashamed  adj. 1 feeling no guilt. 2 blatant; bold.  unashamedly adv.

Pointer  n. 1 thing that points, e.g. The index hand of a gauge. 2 rod for pointing to features on a chart etc. 3 colloq. Hint. 4 dog of a breed that on scenting game stands rigid looking towards it. 5 (in pl.) Two stars in the great bear in line with the pole star.
Portrait  n. 1 drawing, painting, photograph, etc. Of a person or animal, esp. Of the face. 2 description in words.  portraitist n. [french: related to *portray]




Drainage  n. 1 draining. 2 system of drains. 3 what is drained off.
Sheaves  pl. Of *sheaf.
Elemental  adj. 1 of or like the elements or the forces of nature; powerful. 2 essential, basic.
Nympho  n. (pl. -s) colloq. Nymphomaniac. [abbreviation]
Fritter2  n. Fruit, meat, etc. Coated in batter and fried. [french friture from latin frigo *fry1]


Corked  adj. 1 stopped with a cork. 2 (of wine) spoilt by a decayed cork.
Kinetic  adj. Of or due to motion.  kinetically adv. [greek kineo move]

Yha  abbr. Youth hostels association.

Burgher  n. Citizen of a continental town. [german or dutch]




Ferial  adj. Eccl. (of a day) not a festival or fast. [latin feria *fair2]
Padded cell  n. Room with padded walls in a mental hospital.




Pilot  —n. 1 person who operates the controls of an aircraft. 2 person qualified to take charge of a ship entering or leaving harbour. 3 (usu. Attrib.) Experimental undertaking or test (pilot scheme). 4 guide. —v. (-t-) 1 act as a pilot of. 2 conduct or initiate as a pilot. [greek pedon]
Sulphide  n. (us sulfide) binary compound of sulphur.

Hazel  n. 1 hedgerow shrub bearing round brown edible nuts. 2 greenish-brown. [old english]
Disdain  —n. Scorn, contempt. —v. 1 regard with disdain. 2 refrain or refuse out of disdain.  disdainful adj. Disdainfully adv. [latin: related to *de-, *deign]
Overdevelop  v. (-p-) 1 develop too much. 2 photog. Treat with developer for too long.
Wysiwyg  adj. (also wysiwyg) computing denoting a form of text onscreen exactly corresponding to its printout. [acronym of what you see is what you get]
Elder2  n. Tree with white flowers and dark berries. [old english]
Bath salts  n.pl. Soluble powder or crystals for scenting or softening bath-water.

Insignia  n. (treated as sing. Or pl.) Badge. [latin signum sign]

Underfunded  adj. Provided with insufficient money.
Snippet  n. 1 small piece cut off. 2 (usu. In pl.) A scrap of information etc. B short extract from a book etc.

Arrogate  v. (-ting) 1 (often foll. By to oneself) claim (power etc.) Without right. 2 (often foll. By to) attribute unjustly (to a person).  arrogation n. [latin rogo ask]
Intrust  var. Of *entrust.



Baby carriage  n. Us pram.


Septic tank  n. Tank in which sewage is disintegrated through bacterial activity.
Tannic acid  n. Natural yellowish organic compound used as a mordant and astringent.
Veronica  n. Speedwell. [medieval latin, probably from st veronica]

Handbell  n. Small bell for ringing by hand, esp. One of a set.
Slanging-match  n. Prolonged exchange of insults.
Castaway  —n. Shipwrecked person. —adj. Shipwrecked.

Back-boiler  n. Boiler behind a domestic fire.
Reforge  v. (-ging) forge again or differently.
Slippy  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Slippery.  look (or be) slippy make haste.

Committal  n. Act of committing, esp. To prison.


Apostasy  n. (pl. -ies) renunciation of a belief or faith, abandoning of principles, etc. [greek, = defection]
News  n.pl. (usu. Treated as sing.) 1 information about important or interesting recent events, esp. When published or broadcast. 2 (prec. By the) broadcast report of news. 3 newly received or noteworthy information. [from *new]



Introvert  —n. 1 person predominantly concerned with his or her own thoughts. 2 shy thoughtful person. —adj. (also introverted) characteristic of an introvert.  introversion n.
Self-congratulatory  adj. = *self-satisfied.  self-congratulation n.
Overate  past of *overeat.

Stars and stripes  n.pl. National flag of the us.
Cruet  n. 1 set of small salt, pepper, etc. Containers for use at table. 2 such a container. [anglo-french diminutive: related to *crock2]

Giddy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 dizzy, tending to fall or stagger. 2 a mentally intoxicated (giddy with success). B excitable, frivolous, flighty. 3 making dizzy (giddy heights).  giddily adv. Giddiness n. [old english]
